isis.stitle: VT-365 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (2002) - PERFORMANCE DIAGNOSTICS - Test Procedures - Fuel Pressure

svcproc.title: Fuel Pressure
svcproc.para: To check for correct fuel pressure

note.para: If the fuel filter has a Water In Fuel (WIF) probe, ask the operator if the WIF lamp was on during vehicle operation.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the foreword of this manual. Follow all warnings, cautions, and notes.

step1.para: See Appendix A in this manual for specifications, and record on Performance Diagnostics form.
Remove plug from fuel filter housing (lower rear left).

warning.para: To prevent serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle - comply with the following:
When routing test line , do not crimp the line, run the line too close to moving parts, or let the line touch hot engine surfaces.

step1.para: Connect a line from fuel/oil pressure test coupler to the 0-160 PSI gauge on gauge bar, then connect to test fitting.

warning.para: To prevent serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle - comply with the following:
When running the engine in the service bay, make sure the parking brake is set, the transmission is in neutral, and the wheels are blocked.

step1.para: Measure minimum fuel pressure at low idle and high idle

item.para: If fuel pressure is low replace fuel filter, clean strainer, and retest.
If fuel pressure is still low, do Test 4 (Fuel Inlet Restriction).

step1.para: Remove fuel pressure test fitting and install plug.

item.para: Dirt or jelled fuel in the fuel filter will cause high restriction and low fuel pressure.
A kinked or bent fuel supply line or a blocked pickup tube can cause high restriction and low fuel pressure.
A loose fuel line on the suction side of the fuel system can ingest air into the system and cause low fuel pressure.
Internal fuel pump damage or damage to the drive gear
